column4: I am trying to copy a directory into another one doing: mv dir1/ dir2/  , dir1 is not empty, but I want to copy it entiriely into dir2, ... I only get this error message:mv: cannot move `cacheexclude' to `3rd party/cacheexclude': Directory not empty

I am trying to copy a directory into another one doing: mv dir1/ dir2/  , dir1 is not empty, but I want to copy it entiriely into dir2, ... I only get this error message:mv: cannot move `cacheexclude' to `3rd party/cacheexclude': Directory not empty
-R does not work for MV command
I can copy them, but I want to know how to move them (erasing the origin)
I was wrong, -R isn't an option. You probably want cp though, or mv -f
so for directories only CP works? no MV?
